{"step_by_step_thinking": "The transmission of herpes from mother to child is highest if the mother contracts a primary infection during the third trimester of pregnancy. However, the risk of transmission to the newborn is 30–57% in cases where the mother acquired a primary infection in the third trimester of pregnancy. The risk of transmission by a mother with existing antibodies for both HSV-1 and HSV-2 has a much lower (1–3%) transmission rate.", "answer_choice": "C. During parturition"}
